name: andouillette
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a type of small sausage popular in France, made with offal (= inside parts of an animal's body such as the intestine or the inside covering of the stomach): Specialities of this region include andouillette, a savoury tripe sausage. I had salade de tomates, followed by a grilled andouillette. Compare
andouille
More examplesFewer examplesThe main courses of cassoulet and andouillette promise some heavy peasant flavours.True andouillette is rarely seen outside France and has a strong, distinctive odour related to its intestinal origins and components.Andouillettes are most definitely not to be confused with Cajun andouille, which I unfortunately did when ordering my first real Breton savoury crèpes.A piece of imported andouillette sausage is served with a smear of mustardy mash.The singer was seen as a mystifying French obsession, like mime or the andouillette sausage.
